reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were visiting Montreal for the evening (from Ottawa) and we were frantic trying to find a place to stay, as nearly every hotel was booked up due to a music festival that we were unaware was taking place that weekend. I had stayed at the Delta before, and I'd had a decent stay, but the rooms were rather dated at that time. What a pleasant surprise this time! The rooms were newly renovated, large and very modern. The girl at the front desk was VERY pleasant and told us that she'd put us in a nice room since we were so exhausted from hotel searching all evening. The room was just lovely and very clean. The bathrooms were gorgeous, had large counters, and a decently sized stand-up shower. The renovations were obviously not complete yet, as there were no baseboards in the hallway, but that's not a big deal. It happens. Overall, we had a great experience and we will be staying here again when we return in a few weeks with some friends.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay!

reviews.text: Recently stayed a week here. The hotel is centrally located in downtown within walking distance of a number of downtown sites such as McGill University and Old Montreal. The hotel public areas such as the lobby and the restaurant were very nice, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Ate the breakfast buffet one morning, and it was excellent though rather expensive (~$20). The room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The A/C worked very well. I've read about the hotel going through some renovation, and I believe my room was one of those that had been renovated. It was nice but it appeared as if some of the finishing touches (e.g. baseboards) were still to be completed. The biggest issue was with the room's internet access. The renovated rooms are equipped with a new "SmartDesk", which consists of a desk with various types of connectors (e.g. Ethernet for wired internet access, HDMI for playing video from your PC to the flat screen TV, etc.) In the case of my room, the wired Ethernet cable did not work, and I was told that their wireless internet was better anyway. Well, it was good, as long as my laptop was near the entrance to the room. If I sat at the desk or on my bed, the wireless access cut in and out. Needless to say, this was rather frustrating when I was trying to check email or get on Skype. So, I had to sit near the door to maintain an Internet connection. The bottom line: while I would be willing to stay here again, I would probably consider other options in downtown. And if location was not an issue, I would be inclined to stay further down the island in the Hotel du Fort (where I've stayed in years past), where the value might be a little better.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay with a Few Technical Wrinkles
Will be back
reviews.text: We used to stay at Delta's in Montreal but stopped because the hotels were in rough shape with old rooms and bathrooms I couldn't stand. We thought we'd give give this one a try since it has recently been renovated. We stayed in a renovated room with two queen beds, and were very happy. The room was a good size and it's nice to have some distance between the beds and bathroom. The bathroom is all new and has lots of counter space, which was nice with three people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good for St. Catherine Street, it's only a couple of blocks from The Bay. Parking underground was easy. We will stay here again now that the hotel is redone and we collect points. We prefer the location of this one to the other Delta, it's closer to St. Catherine.
reviews.title: Hard to locate, but worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel on Hotels.com and got a great price. Parking was $26.50/night but the hotel has been recently renovated and is thoroughly modern. There is even a smart desk in our room. WiFi was complimentary but breakfast was not. The mattress was very comfortable. The hotel was hard to locate because President Kennedy Avenue is only 4 blocks long and many of the streets in downtown Montreal are one-way. But it has a central location and good food in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Rooms need updating

reviews.text: Three day trip with friends. Hotel is close to centre of downtown but not too close. Very comfortable, excellent facilities and really good breakfast buffet. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here except for the rude member of staff in the bar who, apparently not understanding my Glasgow accented English, asked me to repeat myself in a very unprofessional manner. Enough to make me leave the bar without ordering.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in a great location

reviews.text: Please note, this one apparently minor negative exchange could have adversely coloured the whole experience. Stayed away from the bar and the other staff were all very pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Good, one thing kept me from giving it a perfect score

reviews.text: Renovated, overall the room was large and well appointed some spots still a little rough while the reno is ongoing but certainly not a show stopper. I found a shirt in my room on the floor when I checked in, I brought it to the front desk and they apologized but didn't do anything to turn the bad experience around. Most high end chains will turn a bad experience into an opportunity to impress the guest and they blew it. I'm not looking for a comp or anything but do something to make me as a guest talk about the good thing delta did rather than... Nothing.
reviews.title: Vacation Headquarters

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was indeed a pleasant place to stay. I'd picked it because it was stated to be kid-friendly, and we found it extremely flexible for children. There are half-price, or specials on the kids' menu at the restaurant. The only area I'd say was NOT kid friendly was the pool, which is a lap pool with an open lane for free swimming. Nice if your child swims, but five feet deep and no shallow end for non-swimmers. Our grandchild found it intimidating. When we asked for extra chairs for our balcony, they were delivered promptly and pleasantly: great service when requested. Parking in the hotel underground...excellent. Convenient to Vieux Montreal and business district , both are a short but pleasant walk.
reviews.title: Renovated Beauty

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this Delta hotel for two nights. Most of this hotel has been newly renovated. We stayed on the twentieth floor.The floor was completely renovated with new carpeting in the hallways and freshly painted walls. We had a newly renovated room with a King size bed.The bed and room furniture was modern and all appeared new. The bed was extremely comfortable. The washroom was quite spacious with a large stand up shower. Everything in our room was clean,neat and tidy. The air conditioning worked well and was not noisy.The wireless internet worked well. Parking is underground and will accommodate vehicles as large as a half ton truck or full size SUV. The parking area is clean, well lit and easy to access. We did not use the restaurants or spa facilities. Some of the public areas of the hotel were under renovation during our visit and I was told by front desk staff that these will continue until the hotel is completely renovated. Hotel staff were courteous, friendly and helpful. The hotel is within walking distance of McGill University, restaurants, shopping, entertainment and Old Montreal. Overall, we had a superb experience and we would stay at this hotel again. I would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: I hated to leave

reviews.text: We booked through Hotwire as a last minute deal and paid $211.00 US for two nights. When doing so we were under the impression we were getting an amazing deal on a hotel which at regular price was $224.00 a night. We were wrong.
reviews.title: ~Not As Nice As They Make It Seem~

reviews.text: Perhaps I am too picky and maybe a bit anal, but the pictures advertised and displayed on the internet are not an accurate reflection of the hotel and the rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at noon on our day of check-in. The hotel is in a good location more in the business district, but relatively close to everything. The lobby was nice and appealing. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and allowed us an early check-in.
reviews.title: Middle of the Road
Large rooms, dismal decor!
reviews.text: Our room, located on the 12th floor was not a 3 star, and by far not a 4 star as some places advertise it as. The entire floor smelled like cigarette smoke as did our room. Both were in poor condition. The carpets were filty and all the furnishing were VERY dated. Basic bathoom. The window were so dirty you could barely see out of them. And the balcony is hardly such as one chair could not fit there; it is a concete enclosure and not at all appealing.

reviews.title: The place to stay
reviews.text: We brought our 7 month old with us and fed her on the bed accidently spilling her entire bowl on cereal on the sheets. The next day at bedtime we noticed that the sheets had not been changed. I requested some be brought up to us and moments later they arrived damp with stray hairs on them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Delta on Thursday and the first thing we noticed was the faint smell of smoke in the hallways. We overlooked that seeing that we were in Canada. Everything was good until Saturday night when there was a wedding that took place right below our room on the 2nd floor. The music was blasting and after complaining three times we were told that the room was rented to the wedding party until 3am and there was nothing they can do about it. We were offered to move to a different room but who wants to pack their stuff up at 12:30 AM to sleep somewhere else. The joy comes Sun morning when we go to leave and our Hummer H3 is simply gone form the parking lot. We were told that it is possible for anyone to purchase a ticket for parking in the ramp so anyone can actually take your car out without being suspicious. The police took 45 min to come and didn't even investigate. I believe it was an inside job. Waiting to hear from hotel. Onstar system did not work so these people are professionals since there was no evidence of a breakin. The service for the most part was good and the location is good, but BE SMART. DO NOT PARK CAR HERE even though it is underneath the hotel and seems safe. For $21 a day to park, I expect more than sorry your truck is gone and we have no answers because there is no security watching the parking lot.
reviews.title: Hummer Stolen in Lot Be Careful

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Delta several times.
reviews.title: A dump

reviews.text: I come only to work. The IT system is a disaster. The internet works about 10% iof the time and they have the gall to say that "this is the first time that..."
reviews.title: Don't Confuse with the Delta Center-Ville
total wipe out
reviews.text: Last week, their excuse was that "we have to fly in a spare part from Toronto", which does not say too much about the state affairs is.
The air conditioning is erractic; the elevators are slow.
reviews.title: A nice stay

reviews.text: Having booked on the Internet for a family wedding trip, the fact that the Jazz festival was on was a bonus.
reviews.title: Cool room hot jazz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was a two minute walk to the site and the same to the metro, if you fly into Montreal you get the bus to the hotel . The room we got was a corner room with balcony , and for the price a really great room all of the staff were excellent and very helpfull, This is our second trip to Montreal and I will stay here again ,I can't think of any negative points for his hotel.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel, very clean, beautiful room.

reviews.text: I believethey are in the process of renovating the whole hotel. Our room was just renovated, it was clean, big, beautiful. We had a king size bed. We didn't use any of the other amenities, but we loved the room. The reception area is very clean and very beautiful as well. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone that plans to go to Montreal, also it is very close to the main roads and actions.
reviews.title: Big room

reviews.text: The room must have been upgraded as it was modern (newly renovated ) and very big. It's our first road trip with the dogs and we picked Delta because of their pet policy (we checked out a lot of others). There wasn't a lot green space nearby so the dogs just did their business on the sidewalk. Even though it was a short stay we were very satisfied.
reviews.title: Very large rooms!

reviews.text: Hi,
reviews.title: Beautiful new rooms

reviews.text: I spent a short stay in this hotel in July, and thoroughly enjoyed it. The check-in staff in the morning was very friendly and efficient. Due to the early arrival, my room was not ready, but the receptionist promptly suggested us to have a complimentary buffet breakfast while the room was being finished. Very nice touch.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: The room has been freshly renovated. Very comfortable bed, chic stylish decor, appropriate lighting (bed board mounted reading light a nice touch). However, it fell short on some details: mounted TV does not rotate for the other bed. The balcony remains a slab of unwelcoming concrete.
reviews.title: Nicely Renovated

reviews.text: By the way, the location of the hotel is just a bit off the downtown core, but requires a mere 10-minute walk. But there is a supermarket only a couple minutes walk up the hill. And the quality and quantity of buffet breakfast can only be described as adequate, particularly the lack of choice in the hot items (only 1 style of egg: scrambled).
reviews.title: Good Location! Poor Sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facilities are above average with nice appointed fitness centre and sizeable pool.
reviews.title: Good location, love the fresh new look of the hotel.

reviews.text: Overall, I will not hesitate to book this hotel again in the future.
reviews.title: Great Updated Hotel and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to Montreal for a romantic getaway..The hotel was average, did stay in the upper suits (23rd floor) Room was clean but not as big as they made it out to be. Mini bar and snacks were way too pricey to use and the fridge was warm. Hotel is in a great central location so you can walk to anything downtown, which is good because driving in Montreal can be tricky. Hotel garage was over priced to me and very tight to drive in. Spa at hotel was nice but dont waste your time on pedicures. Breakfast was good, didn't eat dinner at hotel. Was not impressed with the elevators, three of them yet wait time was frustrating at times, seemed like only one worked. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Just another Hotel

reviews.text: I was visiting a friend in Montreal and we were finding the hotels to be very expensive. We rolled the dice and found a hotel on Hotwire for $63 US a night. The hotel turned out to be Delta Montreal. I immediately came to TripAdvisor to check out the comments and was a little worried. I called the hotel and requested a double bed and was told all that was available was a King. The girl said she would put it in my file that I would like a double and if one became available they would assign it to me. When we arrived at the hotel, the gentleman that registered us was very nice and said that I got a double bed (yea!). When I got to the room I was very pleasantly surprised. Two double beds, a balcony,and very large room. It had a desk, two chairs, table, dresser and lots of room to move around. The room was clean, the beds comfy and the staff was nice.
reviews.title: Great Location!

likes.disliked: — expensive parking and internet was not free

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had NO problems parking in the underground parking at the hotel (except it was $21 a day!).
reviews.title: Bravo Delta Montreal

reviews.text: I would definately recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: A much better stay than the Hotel Champ De Mars
Spa review
reviews.text: Just spent a week in the Delta Montreal and LOVED IT! ... Our room was on the 20th floor with gorgeous views of high rise buildings. We had a king sized bed, a well appointed lounge area with tables chairs and bureaus .. as well as a desk area. We took coffee on the balcony ... and wore plush white bathrobes provided in the room.

I really enojoyed staying at the Delta in Montreal. The staff were pleasant (not exactly friendly, but they were very helpful in a business-like way), the food was nice, and my room was really nice, had a good view, and was clean.
reviews.title: Great hotel :-)
Get the club room option - most for your $$$
reviews.text: The only niggle was that I came back to my room at about 3pm one day, to find someone disassembling my bed to put a new headboard on! He looked at me, and said that he could come back later, but I told him to carry on, and left the room.
I didn't go swimming, so I can't comment about the state of the pool, but the location of the hotel really is excellent.
reviews.title: What we expected
Good value, nice room
reviews.text: The TV was nice and big, the facilities were good, I got a box of chocolates from a local casino one day, and a couple of other chocolates were left on my bed every day (little touches, but they all improve the experience). I really enjoyed my stay here, and I'm usually quite fussy about hotels!

My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights and were impressed. Overall an excellent stay, seamless check-in and -out, timely and friendly housekeeping, accommodating bilingual staff. The rooms were typical of a chain hotel but our 21st floor corner room, though shaped oddly (would not be good for larger people due to the small space in between the desk that stuck out and the foot of the king-size bed), it was clean, fresh and comfortable with a large bathroom (no problems with hot water, even for two separate showers in a row) and small balcony with a great view. We found the bed, pillows and comforter very soft and comfortable. The TV had basic cable that did tend to fuzz out very slightly and sputter a little in rainy weather. With the club room upgrade (an extra $20 a night on Orbitz) we got free continental breakfast two floors up in a lounge area as well as daily happy hour with delicious appetizers and an honor bar. The food was definitely above-average for a hotel spread, and the staff so friendly. My boyfriend loved the fitness room, which seemed small at first but had enough to keep him occupied all three days, and I hung out at the indoor pool (too small to really have fun in, but clean, not very crowded and not too warm or cold) and hot tub, which was nice, but not very new or high-tech. The location was by far the best - walking distance to old montreal, the southern plateau area, all the shopping, and bars and restaurants. We didn't need to take the metro anywhere. We will stay at the Delta Montreal again, especially if we get a similar flight-and-hotel deal from a site like Orbitz.
reviews.title: Nothing to rave about!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Montreal is a very expensive city. The Delta hotel is a great deal. Of course it has its trade-offs, but if you read carefully what other visitors have written here, you can easily avoid them.
reviews.title: No complaints, good decision after reading Trip Advisor's reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Delta for one night. This is not my first time in Montreal, so I know location already makes this hotel a great catch. I got a deal on Hotwire, and following the advice given by a previous visitor, I accepted the 20 dollar upgrade offered at the desk.
reviews.title: Good Value, but some issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a very spacious room on the 15th floor, super clean, quiet, with a nice view to other office buildings (that's all there is to see ). Staff was very friendly. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Good location but ...

likes.disliked: — Many things that did not work well (phone, parkade exit, Internet access)

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 6 days and 5 nights. For those who want the skinny, it’s a good hotel for those on a budget and those with kids. There were a few issues, hence the title, but overall, the stay was ok.
reviews.title: Go for the upgrade

likes.liked: — If you take a cab, make sure YOU know where you're going, because the drivers don't!

reviews.text: This was our first time in Montreal. As African Americans, we felt very comfortable.There are tons of hotels to choose from. We got a great deal from Atlanta Hartsfield for 2 at just under $1300. The good:
reviews.title: good location

likes.disliked: — concierge-not helpful and clearly paid by local bad eating houses
